intro: Cyrtandra staminea, commonly known as the stamen cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant produces showy, bilaterally symmetrical blooms that attract various pollinators, including bees and hummingbirds. Cyrtandra staminea is often found growing in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and mountainous areas. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a glossy surface, and it has a woody stem that can branch out into multiple stems.
